Substeps.Procedure: User Pam executed payload rcs.3aka3.doc
Substeps.Criteria: The rcs.3aka3.doc process spawning from explorer.exe

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed explorer.exe executing rcs.3aka3.doc.
A General alert detection was generated for a new application in AppCompat, indicating an application executing for the first time.
Footnotes: The logic for this detection was enabled after the start of the evaluation so the detection is identified as a Detection Configuration Change.

Detections.Detection_Note: A Technique alert detection called "Execution from User Directory" was generated due to the rcs.3aka3.doc process executing from a user's desktop.
An MSSP detection occurred for user Pam executing rcs.3aka3.doc.

Substeps.Procedure: Used unicode right-to-left override (RTLO) character to obfuscate file name rcs.3aka3.doc (originally cod.3aka.scr)
Substeps.Criteria: Evidence of the right-to-left override character (U+202E) in the rcs.3aka.doc process OR the original filename (cod.3aka.scr)

Detections.Detection_Note: A General alert detection was generated for Generic.Exploit.Shellcode on rcs.3aka3.doc.
A Technique alert detection called "RTL OVERRIDE ATTACK (METHODOLOGY)" was generated due to rcs.3aka3.doc containing a RTLO character with an MZ header value.
A MSSP detection occurred for the RTLO character in rcs.3aka.doc.

Substeps.Procedure: Established C2 channel (192.168.0.5) via rcs.3aka3.doc payload over TCP port 1234

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed the rcs.3aka3.doc process connecting to 192.168.0.5 on TCP port 1234.
A Technique alert detection called "Uncommon Port Connection" was generated due to  rcs.3aka3.doc connecting to remote port 1234.
Footnotes: The logic for this detection was enabled after the start of the evaluation so the detection is identified as a Detection Configuration Change.

Detections.Detection_Note: An MSSP detection occurred for the rcs.3aka3.doc process connecting to 192.168.0.5 on TCP port 1234.

Substeps.Procedure: Used RC4 stream cipher to encrypt C2 (192.168.0.5) traffic
Substeps.Criteria: Evidence that the network data sent over the C2 channel is encrypted

Detections.Detection_Note: Minimum detection criteria was not met for this procedure.
An MSSP detection occurred for the rcs.3aka3.doc process using rc4 encryption for network communication.

Substeps.Procedure: Spawned interactive cmd.exe
Substeps.Criteria: cmd.exe spawning from the rcs.3aka3.doc process

Subtechnique.Subtechnique_Name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed rcs.3aka3.doc spawning from cmd.exe. This was correlated to a parent alert on rcs.3aka3.doc.
A Technique alert detection called "CMD Execution" was generated due to cmd.exe spawning from rcs.3aka3.doc.
An MSSP detection occurred for cmd.exe spawning from rcs.3aka3.doc.

Substeps.Procedure: Spawned interactive powershell.exe

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed powershell.exe spawning from cmd.exe.
Footnotes: Though no image was captured, MITRE confirmed that the vendor has the capability to show available telemetry in a separate view.

Detections.Detection_Note: A General alert detection was generated for cmd.exe spawning a child process.
A Technique alert detection called "PowerShell Execution" was generated due to powershell.exe spawning from cmd.exe.
An MSSP detection occurred for powershell.exe spawning from cmd.exe.

Substeps.Procedure: Dropped stage 2 payload (monkey.png) to disk
Substeps.Criteria: The rcs.3aka3.doc process creating the file monkey.png

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed rcs.3aka3.doc creating monkey.png.
A General alert detection called "User Directory File Write" was generated due to the file monkey.png being written to the user's desktop.
Footnotes: The logic for this detection was enabled after the start of the evaluation so the detection is identified as a Detection Configuration Change.

Detections.Detection_Note: An MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of rcs.3aka3.doc creating the monkey.png.

Substeps.Procedure: Embedded PowerShell payload in monkey.png using steganography
Substeps.Criteria: Evidence that a PowerShell payload was within monkey.png

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed PowerShell extracting and executing the code embedded within monkey.png.
An MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of the PowerShell script contained within monkey.png.

Substeps.Procedure: Modified the Registry to enable COM hijacking of sdclt.exe using PowerShell

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed the addition of the DelegateExecute Registry Value.
An MSSP detection occurred for the addition of the DelegateExecute Registry Value.

Substeps.Procedure: Deleted rcs.3aka3.doc on disk using SDelete

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed sdelete.exe running with command-line arguments to delete the file and the subsequent file rename and delete events.
A General alert detection was generated for powershell.exe creating the sdelete64.exe child process.
A General alert detection was generated for the execution of a Sysinternals utility.
A Technique alert detection called "Sdelete Command Execution" was generated due to the execution of sdelete64.exe to delete rcs.3aka3.doc.
An MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of sdelete64.exe deleting the file.

Substeps.Procedure: Created a new service (javamtsup) that executes a service binary (javamtsup.exe) at system startup

Subtechnique.Subtechnique_Name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed PowerShell created the new service javamtsup.
Footnotes: Though no image was captured, MITRE confirmed that the vendor has the capability to show available telemetry in a separate view.

Detections.Detection_Note: A General alert detection was generated for javamtsup.exe being classified as malware.
A Technique alert detection called "Service Persistence" was generated due to the modification of Windows service Registry keys when the javamtsup service was created.
An MSSP detection occurred for the creation of the javamtsup service.

Substeps.Procedure: Created a LNK file (hostui.lnk) in the Startup folder that executes on login
Substeps.Criteria: powershell.exe creating the file hostui.lnk in the Startup folder

Subtechnique.Subtechnique_Name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed PowerShell creating the hostui.lnk file in the Startup folder. The event was correlated to a parent detection for PowerShell.
A General alert detection was generated due to a suspicious LNK file.
A Technique alert detection called "Startup Folder Persistence" was generated due to the creation of a file in the Start Menu Startup folder.
An MSSP detection occurred for the creation of the hostui.lnk file in the Startup folder.

Substeps.Procedure: Masqueraded a Chrome password dump tool as accesscheck.exe, a legitimate Sysinternals tool
Substeps.Criteria: Evidence that accesschk.exe is not the legitimate Sysinternals tool

Subtechnique.Subtechnique_Name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location

Substeps.Procedure: Dumped password hashes from the Windows Registry by injecting a malicious DLL into Lsass.exe
Substeps.Criteria: powershell.exe injecting into lsass.exe OR lsass.exe reading Registry keys under HKLM:\SAM\SAM\Domains\Account\Users\

Detections.Detection_Note: A General detection in Process Guard Watcher was generated due to powershell.exe injecting into lsass.exe.
An MSSP detection identified PowerShell injecting into the LSASS process. This activity was labeled as credential harvesting.

Detections.Detection_Note: An MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of powershell.exe executing Invoke-ScreenCapture to capture screen shots.

Substeps.Procedure: Exfiltrated collection (OfficeSupplies.7z) to WebDAV network share using PowerShell
Substeps.Criteria: powershell executing Copy-Item pointing to an attack-controlled WebDav network share (192.168.0.4:80)

Subtechnique.Subtechnique_Name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol: Exfiltration Over Unencrypted/Obfuscated Non-C2 Protocol

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed PoweShell Copy-Item to a remote adversary WebDav network share (192.168.0.4).
Footnotes: Though no image was captured, MITRE confirmed that the vendor has the capability to show available telemetry in a separate view.

Detections.Detection_Note: A General alert detection was generated for the file write of OfficeSupplies.7z to a remote adversary WebDav network share (192.168.0.4).
A Technique alert detection called "WebDav Network Request" was generated due to a WebDav user-agent being used to PUT OfficeSupplies.7z on a WebDav network share.
An MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of OfficeSupplies.7z being uploaded to 192.168.0.4 using WebDav.

Substeps.Procedure: Added a new user to the remote host Scranton (10.0.1.4) using net.exe

Detections.Detection_Note: Telemetry showed wsmprovhost.exe spawning net.exe with the command-line arguments to add the new user Toby.
Footnotes: Though no image was captured, MITRE confirmed that the vendor has the capability to show available telemetry in a separate view.

Detections.Detection_Note: A General alert detection called WinRM process activity was generated for for wsmprovhost.exe spawning net.exe with the command-line arguments to add the new user Toby.
A Technique alert detection called "Net User Add" was generated for net.exe with the command-line arguments to add the new user Toby.
An MSSP detection occurred for the creation of the user Toby on Scranton (10.0.1.4).
